function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Malaria risk mapping and prediction based on spatial covariates, vegetation amounts, and population density.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Analysis of population mobility patterns and trends in namibia, revealing shorter distance movements and increasing phone usage.","category":"Transport","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Human movement contributing to the spread of contagious diseases such as malaria.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High levels of movement within communities can lead to rapid transmission of contagious diseases.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Returning residents and visitors from risk areas can potentially carry infections to their home location or new destination, increasing the risk of disease spread.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Movement of individuals between urban and rural areas","category":"Transport","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inability to identify and analyze movements of travellers and migrants","category":"Transport","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Biases in the age distribution of mobile phone owners may affect the accuracy of the study’s findings and general estimates of human mobility.","category":"Transport","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of travel history information from patients","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of geolocated data for mapping malaria risk","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Integration of movement data with case-based risk maps for namibia creates a dynamic framework for understanding connectivity between malaria risk areas.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Achieving malaria elimination in namibia by 2020 requires a clearly defined strategy to deploy resources effectively.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Targeting aggressive attack measures to source communities and implementing sustainable measures in sink regions is essential for reducing malaria transmission in namibia.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Asymptomatic infections leading to undetected transmission","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of consideration of social risk in policy development","category":"Health","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Varying credit guarantee ratios for different countries and banks","category":"Finances","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Difficulty in accessing finance for smes","category":"Finances","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact of macroeconomic variables on npl/l without considering health-related factors","category":"Finances","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of long-run linkages between macroeconomic variables and bank profile components.","category":"Finances","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Empirical analysis based on pca and cluster analysis","category":"Finances","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Credit constraints affecting smes’ employment and operations","category":"Finances","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of interoperability in cross-border exchange of electronic health data","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inability to directly interact and view data in federated systems","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of common standards in health data across member states","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of interoperability between community-developed data standards","category":"Health","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Classical format of research funding is slow and may not generate evidence and knowledge fast enough in dynamic situations like a pandemic.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of standard wording for broad informed consent may hinder data sharing and collaboration in research projects.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Knowledge scouting activities are not included, leading to delayed evidence production and limited confirmation of scientific importance.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Integration of data from large-scale cohort data sets across europe","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Poorly documented process of harmonising and integrating data from existing projects","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Challenges in controlling competing risks and biases when harmonizing data from heterogeneous populations","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Difficulties in engaging hospitals to participate in observational studies","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of interoperability of heterogeneous health-related data","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Constraints of sharing and utilizing sensitive health data","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Link between climate change and infectious diseases","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Intensified animal rearing and complex commodity ’webs’ in the global south","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Domination of techno-scientific concepts over politico-economic factors in delineating causal factors for disease transmission","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inability to untangle the complexities of multi-factorial pathways through which planning impacts urban health","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact of urbanization on zoonoses in the global south","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reduced biodiversity depletes the possibility of alternate hosts for disease transmission.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Animal rearing creates a risk of domesticated animals acting as intermediate hosts for viruses to evolve and infect humans.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Complexity in factoring natural birth and death rates of a population","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Complexity in factoring spatial movement of populations","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Compartmentalization complexity in epidemic models","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lockdowns reducing community transmission but halting economic activity","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Human settlement and activity increase human-wildlife interfaces and facilitate interspecific pathogen transmission","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of proactive interaction with students may result in missed opportunities to identify and address health concerns or symptoms of contagious diseases.","category":"Education","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Failure to act as representatives of the university may lead to missed opportunities to enforce health and safety measures and educate the campus community on disease prevention.","category":"Education","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of social distancing in classrooms","category":"Education","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Shared patrol car assignments","category":"Security","confidence":"High"}]}
